wikipedia_page.main: Geoffrey Taylor Bull (24 June 1921 – 11 April 1999) was an English Christian missionary and author.

response: * Geoffrey Bull (1921–1999), a Scottish Christian missionary and author

The government of Tibet had many foreigners in its employ, including Britons Reginald Fox, Robert W. Ford, Geoffrey Bull, and George Patterson; Austrians Peter Aufschnaiter and Heinrich Harrer; and the Russian Nedbailoff. The army, in particular, had Japanese, Chinese, and British influence, although the British influence was of such an extent that the Tibetan officers gave their commands in English, and the Tibetan band played tunes including "God Save the King" and "Auld Lang Syne".
* Geoffrey Bull — Missionary to Tibet in the early 1950s
